alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:18PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cameron County through 600 PM CDT... At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stell Middle School, or over Downtown Brownsville, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Olmito, Port Of Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, B I S D Administration Building and Longoria Elementary School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 12. US Highway 281 between mile markers 834 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
